greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: a(n,k) = number of paths of n upsteps U and n downsteps D that contain k UDUs.
comment: See A091869 for the distribution of the parameter "number of UDUs" on Dyck paths.
reference: Aristidis Sapounakis, Panagiotis Tsikouras, Ioannis Tasoulas, Kostas Manes, Strings of Length 3 in Grand-Dyck Paths and the Chung-Feller Property, Electr. J. Combinatorics, 19 (2012), #P2. - From _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 06 2013
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..141, flattened
example: The path UDUDUD contains 2 UDUs and a(2,1) = 2 because each of UDUD, DUDU contains one UDU.
maple: b:= proc(u, d, t) option remember; `if`(u=0 and d=0, 1,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n$2, 1)):
mathematica: gfForBalancedByNumberUDU=Sqrt[(1 + x - x*y)/(1 - 3*x - x*y)]; Map[CoefficientList[ #, y]&, CoefficientList[Normal[Series[gfForBalancedByNumberUDU, {x, 0, 8}, {y, 0, 8}]], x]]
xref: Column k=0 is A025565. The row sums are the (even) central binomial coefficients A000984.
results.author: _David Callan_, Aug 19 2004; corrected Jun 10 2005
